definition: to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb

sentences.english: It rose as a monument to human ingenuity immovably firm.
sentences.chinese: 它有如人类智慧的丰碑，巍然屹立，岿然不动。

sentences.english: Our frontier guards held up under fierce enemy attack .
sentences.chinese: 我们的边防战士在敌人猛烈进攻下巍然不动。

sentences.english: Stand tall red political power in the land, confrontation with the kuomintang regime.
sentences.chinese: 红色政权巍然屹立在中华大地上，同国民党政权对峙。

sentences.english: Student should fully lengthen their spine and stand tall.
sentences.chinese: 学生应充分延长他们的脊柱和巍然屹立。

sentences.english: This building holds up well despite its age.
sentences.chinese: 尽管年代久远，这座建筑物仍巍然屹立。

sentences.english: The church Stands majestically on the top of the Montmatre hill.
sentences.chinese: 这座宏伟的教堂巍然屹立在蒙马特高地的顶端。

sentences.english: The bridge stands majestic astride the river.
It is said that the Five Element Mountains is from Hercules' hand.
sentences.chinese: 传说那巍然屺立的五指山就是黎族祖先大力神的巨手。

sentences.english: The bridge stands majestic astride the river .
The bridge stands majestic astride the Yangtze River.
sentences.chinese: 这座大桥巍然横跨在长江之上。

sentences.english: The house which was built in 1960 still stayed up in the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 建于1960年的那栋房子在这次地震中巍然屹立。

sentences.english: A pair of large stone lions preside massively over the approach to the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 一对大型石狮巍然耸立在颐和园的入口处。

sentences.english: The Chinese nation is now standing firm in the East.
sentences.chinese: 中华民族巍然屹立在世界东方。

definition: to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
to stand for a long time
